edu.istic.tdf.dfclient.UI

Class AutoScaleTextView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.TextView
        • edu.istic.tdf.dfclient.UI.AutoScaleTextView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener

    public class AutoScaleTextView
extends android.widget.TextView
    A custom Text View that lowers the text size when the text is to big for the TextView. Modified version of one found on stackoverflow

      • setMinTextSize

        public void setMinTextSize(float minTextSize)

      • onTextChanged

        protected void onTextChanged(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                 int start,
                 int before,
                 int after)
        Description copied from class: android.widget.TextView
        This method is called when the text is changed, in case any subclasses would like to know. Within text, the lengthAfter characters beginning at start have just replaced old text that had length lengthBefore. It is an error to attempt to make changes to text from this callback.
        Overrides:
        onTextChanged in class android.widget.TextView
        Parameters:
        text - The text the TextView is displaying
        start - The offset of the start of the range of the text that was modified
        before - The length of the former text that has been replaced
        after - The length of the replacement modified text

      • onSizeChanged

        protected void onSizeChanged(int width,
                 int height,
                 int oldwidth,
                 int oldheight)
        Description copied from class: android.view.View
        This is called during layout when the size of this view has changed. If you were just added to the view hierarchy, you're called with the old values of 0.
        Overrides:
        onSizeChanged in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        width - Current width of this view.
        height - Current height of this view.
        oldwidth - Old width of this view.
        oldheight - Old height of this view.
